Issue.summary: Timeout errors infinitely appear in rust logs if indy-cli was not connected to the pool during extended timeout
Issue.description: indy-cli can't connect during timeout. Actual Results: Following messages infinitely appear in rust logs: {code:java} TRACE|indy::services::pool::pool | src/services/pool/pool.rs:527 | received pool event: Some(Timeout("", "")) TRACE|indy::services::pool::pool | src/services/pool/pool.rs:527 | received pool event: Some(Timeout("", "")) TRACE|indy::services::pool::pool | src/services/pool/pool.rs:527 | received pool event: Some(Timeout("", "")) TRACE|indy::services::pool::pool | src/services/pool/pool.rs:527 | received pool event: Some(Timeout("", "")) TRACE|indy::services::pool::pool | src/services/pool/pool.rs:527 | received pool event: Some(Timeout("", "")) TRACE|indy::services::pool::pool | src/services/pool/pool.rs:527 | received pool event: Some(Timeout("", "")){code} It's impossible to exit the cli normal way, ctrl+c results hanging of indy-cli. Only kill the process works. Expected Results: Timeout error should appear only once. Additional Information: The same case works without any problems without logging. >
